title: 104_hr1024
content: The text amends various sections by replacing "Joint Committee on Printing" with different committees or entities such as the Committee on Rules and Administration of the House of Representatives, the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate, the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives, and the Public Printer. The text amends sections by replacing "Joint Committee on Printing" with different committees or entities such as the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate, the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives, and the Public Printer. The text amends various sections by replacing "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" in different acts and codes. The Humanities Act of 1965, Title 28, Title 40, and Title 44 are amended by replacing "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" in various sections. Title 40 and Title 44 of the Federal Property and Administrative Services Act are amended by removing certain paragraphs and updating references from "Joint Committee on Printing" to "Public Printer." Title 44 Amendments: The table of chapters for title 44, United States Code, is amended by removing the item relating to chapter 1. Section 305(a) of title 44 is also amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" and to change the appeal process to be made under subchapter III of chapter 71 of title 5. Section 309(a) of title 44, United States Code, is amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer". Section 312 of title 44 is also amended to remove the requirement for approval of the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 502 of title 44 is amended as well. Section 504 and 505 of title 44, United States Code, are also amended to change references from the Joint Committee on Printing to the Public Printer. Section 504, 505, and 508 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer and other relevant committees. Section 508, 509, and 510 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate, the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives, and the Public Printer. Section 509 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer. Section 510 and 511 are also amended accordingly. Section 511 of title 44, United States Code is further amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer. Section 512 and 513 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the Committee with the Public Printer. Section 514 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace references to the Committee with the Public Printer. Section 514 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer. The changes include replacing "Joint Committee on Printing shall determine" with "Public Printer shall apply the provisions of subchapter V of chapter 35 of title 31 to resolve" and removing the clause "the decision of the Committee is final as to the United States." Section 515 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing. This includes eliminating the requirement to report defaults to the Committee and removing its direction from the process. Section 515, 517, and 702 of title 44, United States Code are amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing. This includes eliminating the requirement to report defaults to the Committee and removing its direction from the process. The Public Printer is now authorized to act without the need for approval from the Joint Committee on Printing. (16) Section 517 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to authorize the Public Printer directly. (17) Section 702 is amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer". (18) Section 703 is amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with Senate or House Committees. (19) Section 707 is also amended. (19) Section 707 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to authorize the printing of bills or resolutions by the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate or the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives. The Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, may print a bill or resolution, with index and ancillaries, in the style and form deemed most suitable for economy and efficiency until final enactment in both Houses of Congress. The Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, may print a bill or resolution in the style and form considered most suitable for economy and efficiency until final enactment in both Houses of Congress. Section 709 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to replace "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer" in the second sentence. The Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, is authorized to print bills or resolutions in a suitable style until final enactment in Congress. Sections 709 and 714 of title 44, United States Code, are amended to reflect the role of the Public Printer in establishing rules and procedures. Section 714 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to give the Public Printer authority to establish rules in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 717 is also amended to reflect this change. Section 718 is amended as well. Section 717 and 718 of title 44, United States Code, are amended to replace the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives." Section 721(a) is also amended. Section 721(a) of title 44, United States Code, is amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives." Section 721(a) of title 44, United States Code, is amended to replace references to the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives." Additionally, sections 722 and 723 of title 44 are amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing and replace them with the Public Printer. Section 722 of title 44, United States Code, is amended to remove references to the Joint Committee on Printing and Section 723 is amended to replace the Joint Committee with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 724 and 728 of title 44, United States Code, are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer. The Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, will now consider matters previously handled by the Joint Committee. Section 724, 728, and 738 of title 44, United States Code, are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer. The Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, will now handle matters previously overseen by the Joint Committee. Section 738 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 901, 902, and 903 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives, as well as the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives. Section 902, 903, and 905 of title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the Joint Committee on Printing with the Public Printer, in consultation with relevant Senate and House committees and officials. Section 905 of title 44, United States Code is amended to replace the "Joint Committee on Printing" with the "Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives." Section 906 of title 44, United States Code is also amended accordingly. Section 906 of title 44, United States code is amended to send copies to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives, not exceeding one hundred copies each. Section 906 of title 44, United States code is amended to send copies to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives, not exceeding one hundred copies each. Additionally, copies will be sent to each Joint Committee and Joint Commission in Congress as designated by the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives. Section 906 of title 44, United States code is amended to send copies to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives, not exceeding one hundred copies each. Additionally, copies will be sent to designated Joint Committees and Commissions in Congress. The amendment to section 906 of title 44, United States code includes sending ten semimonthly copies to the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate and the Committee on House Oversight of the House of Representatives. Additionally, eight copies may be bound in a style approved by the Public Printer in consultation with the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. The amendment to section 906 of title 44, United States code allows for ten semimonthly copies to be sent to specific committees and eight copies to be bound in a style approved by the Public Printer in consultation with the House of Representatives. Section 1108 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by removing regulation by the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1112 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by replacing "Joint Committee on Printing" with "Public Printer". Section 1121 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by removing direction by the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1301 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by removing directions of the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1320A of title 44, United States Code, is also amended. Section 1333 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by changing the reference from the Joint Committee on Printing to the Public Printer, in consultation with the Secretary of the Senate and the appropriate official of the House of Representatives. Section 1338 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by removing limitations and conditions prescribed by the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1338 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by removing limitations and conditions prescribed by the Joint Committee on Printing. Additionally, Section 1705 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by striking out regulations by the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1710 of title 44, United States Code, is amended by removing approval and direction requirements by the Joint Committee on Printing. Section 1710, 1914, and 5(b) of title 44, United States Code are amended by removing approval and direction requirements by the Joint Committee on Printing. The Act and its amendments will take effect on the first day of the 9th month after enactment.
